definition: to feast one's eyes on (idiom)
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to eat till full/satisfied
eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)
good fortune/happiness/luck
surname Fu/abbr. for Fujian province 福建省[Fu2 jian4 sheng3]

sentences.english: B: I hope I have time to see them all.
sentences.chinese: 但愿我有时间一饱眼福。

sentences.english: I hope I have time to see them all.
sentences.chinese: 但愿我有时间一饱眼福。

sentences.english: A walk around the West Lake is feast for the eyes.
sentences.chinese: 在西湖漫步能让你一饱眼福。

sentences.english: The place abounds in sights on which the eyes may dwell with pleasure.
sentences.chinese: 那个地方有许多可以一饱眼福的景致。

sentences.english: Are we okay just knowing they exist or do we go into them and enjoy them?
sentences.chinese: 仅仅知道它们的存在就行了呢还是进去一饱眼福？

sentences.english: A walk around Kitzbuhel is a feast for eyes.
sentences.chinese: 在基茨比厄尔散散步能够使你一饱眼福。

sentences.english: Now let's feast our eyes on the scenery.
sentences.chinese: 下面就让我们来一饱眼福吧。

sentences.english: Feast your eyes on this diwoulmond.
sentences.chinese: 你看看这钻石一饱眼福吧。

definition: to feast one's eyes
a treat for the eyes/the rare chance of seeing sth beautiful
to feast one's eyes on (idiom)
to look/to have a glimpse at/to observe (sth's splendor)
joy of first experience (idiom)/the pleasure of reading sth for the first time
to eat one's fill/to have a good meal
to look at sth with pleasure/to watch (sth marvelous)/ornamental
to have a taste of/to realize/to appreciate
the trip has not been made in vain/the trip has been well worthwhile/it's been a worthwhile trip
to appreciate/to enjoy/to admire
an overview/at a glance
beautiful face (of a young lady)
lit. too much for the eye to take in (idiom); a feast for the eyes
beautiful scenery
broaden, expand one's horizons
to linger/to remain enjoying oneself and forget to go home
